faqs.question: How long is the student visa valid?
faqs.answer: Student visas are typically issued for the duration of your program, up to one year initially. You can renew your residence permit in Spain for subsequent years.

faqs.question: Can my family accompany me on a student visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, family reunification is possible after you've been in Spain for one year. We can guide you through this process when the time comes.

faqs.question: What if my visa application is rejected?
faqs.answer: Rejections are rare when applications are properly prepared. If it happens, we'll help you understand the reasons and reapply with corrections. Our success rate is over 95%.

faqs.question: Do I need to know Spanish to study in Spain?
faqs.answer: Many programs are offered in English, but knowing Spanish greatly enhances your experience and opens more opportunities. We recommend at least basic Spanish proficiency.

faqs.question: How long does it take to become conversational?
faqs.answer: With consistent study, most students reach conversational level (B1) in 6-9 months. Intensive courses can accelerate this timeline.

faqs.question: Are the courses recognized officially?
faqs.answer: Yes, our courses are aligned with the Common European Framework (CEFR) and we offer DELE exam preparation for official certification.

faqs.question: What documents need sworn translation?
faqs.answer: Typically: birth certificates, academic transcripts, diplomas, police clearance certificates, marriage certificates, and any legal documents required for visa or university applications.

faqs.question: Is sworn translation the same as notarized translation?
faqs.answer: Sworn translation is performed by officially certified translators and carries legal weight in Spain. It's more specific and recognized than general notarized translations.

faqs.question: Do I need apostille as well?
faqs.answer: Often yes, especially for documents from non-EU countries. We can coordinate apostille services for you.

faqs.question: Is health insurance mandatory for student visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, comprehensive health insurance is a mandatory requirement for Spanish student visa applications. The coverage must meet specific minimum requirements.

faqs.question: Can I use Spain's public healthcare?
faqs.answer: International students can access public healthcare, but private insurance is still required for the visa. Many students prefer private insurance for shorter wait times and English-speaking services.

faqs.question: What does the insurance cover?
faqs.answer: Our plans cover medical consultations, hospitalization, emergency care, prescription medications, diagnostic tests, and repatriation. Specific coverage details vary by plan.

residence-permit.longDescription: Navigate the Spanish bureaucracy with ease. We guide you through obtaining your TIE (Tarjeta de Identidad de Extranjero) and help with renewals, ensuring you maintain legal residence throughout your studies.

faqs.question: What's the difference between NIE and TIE?
faqs.answer: NIE is your foreigner identification number, while TIE is the physical residence card that contains your NIE. You need both for legal residence in Spain.

faqs.question: How long is the residence permit valid?
faqs.answer: Initial student residence permits are typically valid for one year. You can renew them annually for the duration of your studies.

faqs.question: What happens if I don't apply within 30 days?
faqs.answer: Late application can result in fines and complications. We help ensure you meet all deadlines to avoid penalties.

academic-equivalency.description: Homologation service to validate your foreign qualifications in Spain.
academic-equivalency.shortDescription: Homologation service to validate your foreign qualifications in Spain.
academic-equivalency.longDescription: Homologation is the process by which the Spanish Ministry of Education recognizes that your secondary school or university qualifications are equivalent to Spanish qualifications. This is often required for university admission and professional practice.

faqs.question: Do I need homologation to study in Spain?
faqs.answer: It depends on your program and university. Many universities accept foreign qualifications directly, but some programs (especially regulated professions) require official homologation.

faqs.question: How long does homologation take?
faqs.answer: The process typically takes 3-12 months, depending on the type of qualification and current processing times at the Ministry of Education.

faqs.question: What if my qualifications aren't fully equivalent?
faqs.answer: The Ministry may grant partial equivalency or require additional coursework. We'll help you understand your options and find the best pathway forward.

bachelors.title: Bachelor's Degree
bachelors.intro: University Bachelor's degrees provide those who obtain them with comprehensive training in a specific discipline and preparation to work or continue studying and gain access to a master's or doctorate.
bachelors.description: Undergraduate courses include basic teaching and general training in the following areas of knowledge: Arts and Humanities, Social Sciences and Law, Health Sciences, Engineering and Architecture.
bachelors.credits: The degrees consist of 240 ECTS credits, which is equivalent to four academic years.

requirements.title: Required Documents for Bachelor's Degree Application:
requirements.item1: A High School Certificate or diploma (SAT, IGCSE, Thanwya Amma, Tawjihi, BAC, etc.)
requirements.item2: A record of grades for all subjects studied during the last three years of high school period
requirements.item3: A copy of a valid passport (valid for at least two years)
requirements.note: *Note: These documents must be legalized from both the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Spanish Consulate.

masters.title: Master's Degree
masters.intro: If you have completed your university studies abroad and want to complete your education with a Master's or Postgraduate, rest assured that Spain is the perfect place to achieve it.

stat1.title: More than 20% international students
stat1.description: Studying a Master in Spain is the preferred decision for hundreds of foreign students. It is actually a growing trend. One of the main reasons is the 'good reputation' of the Spanish university system in Master's studies.

stat2.title: Growing supply of degrees
stat2.description: The degrees offered at the Master's level in Spain have increased by 38% compared to the last decade. In addition, this significant increase is accompanied by a more flexible and agile study offer.

masters.excellence: Studying a Master in Spain is a benchmark of excellence in any professional sector. These qualifications are mainly focused on practice and provide a unique opportunity to build valuable relationships and contacts at the work level.

requirements.title: Required Documents for Master's Degree Application:
requirements.item2: An official transcript of grades for all years of university study
requirements.item3: An Eligibility letter clarifying that the student is able to pursue postgraduate studies and obtain a Master's Degree in accordance with the laws of the student's home country
requirements.item4: A copy of a valid passport
requirements.item6: Additional materials that may enhance the application, such as language certificates, training courses, conference participation, and scientific research publications
requirements.item7: Motivation letter or statement of purpose
requirements.note: *Note: The first three documents (1, 2, and 3) must be legalized from both the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Spanish Consulate.

phd.title: Doctorate / PhD Degree
phd.intro: The Doctorate is the highest university degree that leads to obtaining the title of doctor, it is official and valid throughout the national territory and is recognized throughout the European Higher Education Area.
phd.research: In order to obtain the doctoral degree, it is necessary to demonstrate the ability to carry out original research, autonomously, with an internationally recognizable level of quality, which must culminate in the writing and defense of the doctoral thesis before a panel of expert doctors in the discipline in which said investigation is framed, which will evaluate and determine its sufficiency.
phd.structure: Doctoral training is structured into programs that offer transversal and specific training corresponding to their field, although the essential activity of the doctoral candidate will be research. The programs contemplate various training activities that the doctoral student must carry out during their stay in the program.

requirements.title: Required Documents for PhD Degree Application:
requirements.item2: An official transcript of grades for all years of university study
requirements.item4: An official transcript of grades for the Master's degree
requirements.item5: A statement certifying the student's eligibility to pursue a doctoral degree in their home country
requirements.item6: A copy of a valid passport
requirements.item8: Language certificates, training courses, conference participation, or other academic pursuits
requirements.item9: A doctoral thesis proposal for presentation to supervisors
requirements.note: *Note: The first five documents (1, 2, 3, 4 and 5) must be legalized from both the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Spanish Consulate.

items.question: How long does the visa application process take?
items.answer: The student visa process typically takes 4-8 weeks from the time you submit your complete application. We recommend starting the process at least 3 months before your intended start date to allow time for document preparation and any unforeseen delays.

items.question: What documents do I need to study in Spain?
items.answer: Essential documents include: valid passport, university acceptance letter, proof of financial means, health insurance, background check certificate, and academic transcripts. We provide a complete checklist and guide you through obtaining each document.

items.question: Do I need to speak Spanish to study in Spain?
items.answer: It depends on your program. Many universities offer programs in English, especially at the master's level. However, learning Spanish is highly recommended for daily life and integration. We offer Spanish language courses to help you prepare.

items.question: Can I work while studying in Spain?
items.answer: Yes, international students can work up to 20 hours per week during term time and full-time during holidays. You'll need to obtain a work permit, which we can help you with once you arrive in Spain.

items.question: How do I contact Aval Student Services?
items.answer: You can reach us via our contact form, WhatsApp, email, or phone. We typically respond within 24 hours on business days. For urgent matters, WhatsApp is the fastest way to reach our team.
